repnme.cdata!:
Ecuador - Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was unsatisfactory,
            sustainability is unlikely, and institutional development
            impacts were just modest. Despite a satisfactory performance
            by the Bank, the Borrower performance is rated
            unsatisfactory. Lessons reinforce the critical aspect of
            ownership and government commitment, particularly in a
            difficult political environment, where the Bank should have
            as of the early stages, realistically underlined the risks,
            and potential mitigation of this technical assistance loan
            (TAL) operation. Given the political factors, a TAL on its
            own does not offer enough monetary leverage, or political
            cover to encourage tough legal reforms, or institutional
            changes. Thus the parallel Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL)
            could have been used more effectively to mitigate risks for
            this project, particularly in relation to the governance of
            the deposit guarantee agency -AGD. And yet, reliance on
            parallel budgetary support loans in crisis periods, can lead
            to unexpected risks, namely that conditions (including those
            agreed with partner international financial institutions)
            may be waived, with an impact on the TAL. Nonetheless, while
            not a guarantee of total success, it helped that
            multilateral donors maintained on-going coordination and
            consulted each other in developing a unified framework for
            financial crisis resolution with the Government, within
            which the project contributed positively.

repnme.cdata!:
Ecuador - Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Technical
            Assistance Loan Project aims at assisting the Ecuadorian
            government to manage and confront the deep financial sector
            crisis faced by the country, and strengthening the
            regulatory framework and supervisory capacity of the
            authorities in order to foster the long term soundness and
            efficiency of the banking system. The project consists of
            four components. 1) Strengthening of deposit insurance
            agency will assist in the preparation and regular updating
            of a coherent banking and corporate sector strategy; the
            modernization of legal framework; a study to identify
            obstacles for the sale of assets; institutional
            strengthening; and upgrading of information technology. 2)
            Strengthening of superintendency of banks will finance
            strengthening of in-situ supervision; complementary audits;
            modernization of legal framework; etc. 3) Debt restructuring
            will finance preparation and implementation of a framework
            for corporate and household debt restructuring; elimination
            of obstacles to corporate and household debt restructuring;
            and development of program for debt restructuring of small
            and medium enterprises. 4) The last component will finance
            the project coordination unit and provide training to staff.
